result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian Peter Anglin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: No contact with QQC, or any other members of her family to include face to face, mail, email, telephone, any other electronic devices, or any other third party communication.

Provide DNA sample.
May not consume alcohol or any other illegal substances.
Payment of any restitution, supervision fees, and other court costs.
Follow any correctional programming deemed necessary by the Department of Corrections.
The offender will follow and abide by the Department of Corrections rules and guidelines for sex offenders.
Complete any mental health treatment or program as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
Take any medication as prescribed and when prescribed.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Consecutive to: Ct#1

records.addlTxt: 9:48 Defendant Brian Peter Anglin in court with attorney Matthew Krische.  Defendant Brian Peter Anglin in custody.  William Harold Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Thorie and Krische have reviewed the PSI. Throei: victims rights have been complied with. Thorie presents sentencing argument. requests 6 years prison sentence on each count consecutive: 3 years initial confinement and 3 years extended supervision. Adopt the conditions for ES listed on PSI.  293 days credit. Atty Krishe gives sentencing argument. Stipulates to 293 days credit.  Requests a probation sentence with no conditional jail time. Defendant addresses the court. Court addresses sentencing factors. Court orders 6 year prison sentence: 3 years initial confinement and 3 years ES; on each count, consecutive. Conditions of ES are: as set in the PSI:  maintain a stable residence no contact with victim (QQC) or her family of any kind,   No consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs allowed. May only have the prescribed amount of prescription drugs. Complete any mental health treatment or program as ordered by the DOC. take any medication as prescribed when prescribed. Comply with any conditions imposed by Agent. Court costs. Follow any rules of sex offender requirements determined by the DOC. Court finds Def eligible for challenge incarceration program and substance abuse program. 293 days credit.  Appeal rights are given to the defendant. 10:33
Sentencing hearing on November 7, 2017 at 09:30 am.

11:00 Defendant Brian Peter Anglin in court with attorney Matthew Krische.  Defendant Brian Peter Anglin in custody.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Krische addresses this  matter be continued for a PSI to be prepared. Thorie is ready to proceed. Atty Krische responds: medical illness. Court: revokes bond on this matter. orders another PSI and orders the Defendant to comply PSI. Krische to help Def to otherwise release information to DOC. Court: set for plea as soon as possible, DOC Agent Theis states he can have it done at the end of the week.
I.Q.A
Cover letter with Victim Impact Statement
Sentencing hearing on October 9, 2017 at 10:30 am.

9:30 Defendant Brian Peter Anglin in court with attorney Matthew Krische, both appeared via phone.  William Harold Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 15CF52 heard at this time. Court goes over the Defendant's right to be present in person in court.   Court finds defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to be present in person in court. Thorie: 15CF52 guilty to Ct1 and Ct2, dismiss Ct#3 and 4. 15CF38 dismissed. 3 Dunn County matters will be dismissed and to be considered by this court for sentencing and restitution. Requests PSI.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def pleas guilty to Ct#1 and Ct#2 in 15CF52; Krische stipulates a factual basis.   COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS. Court finds and adjudicates Def guilty to Ct#1 and Ct#2 in 15CF52. Dismiss but read in Ct#3 and #4 in 15CF52 and dismiss but read in 15CF38. Court orders PSI due within 60 days. Court requires the Def to cooperate with the PSI preparation. 9:50
